name: CreateFeatureFlagUsageDashboard
description:
Create or manage feature flag usage dashboards.

This tool allows you to create, read, update, or delete feature flag usage dashboards. It should be called when you need to manage the display and tracking of feature flags in your project.

parameters.name: feature_flag_id
parameters.description: A unique integer identifying this feature flag for the usage dashboard.

value_schema.description: A unique integer value identifying this feature flag.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project you want to access. Retrieve it via a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: feature_flag_request_parameters
parameters.description: JSON object with parameters for creating or updating a feature flag usage dashboard. Includes fields like `id`, `name`, `active`, etc.

name.description: contains the description for the flag (field name `name` is kept for backwards-compatibility)

user_access_level.description: The effective access level the user has for this object

creation_context.description:
Indicates the origin product of the feature flag. Choices: 'feature_flags', 'experiments', 'surveys', 'early_access_features', 'web_experiments'.

* `feature_flags` - feature_flags
* `experiments` - experiments
* `surveys` - surveys
* `early_access_features` - early_access_features
* `web_experiments` - web_experiments

evaluation_runtime.description:
Specifies where this feature flag should be evaluated

* `server` - Server
* `client` - Client
* `all` - All

last_called_at.description: Last time this feature flag was called (from $feature_flag_called events)

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this feature flag.
